result.execSummary:
The defendant Travis W. Wistrom was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Full time employment/schooling/combination of the two; if not, perform 10 hours community service per week.
Absolute sobriety from drugs/alcohol except for prescriptions taken as prescribed and with pre-authorization of agent.

DNA sample.   SAFE program. 

Assessment, treatment, counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent.  

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt: SAFE Program Discharge Summary

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 2:20 pm 
INCLUDES 15CV24, 15CM72, AND 15CM321. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner in 15CM72 and 15CM321; Deft/Respondent appears in person with Atty John Bliss in all. 
Date and time set for hearing on Deft/Respondent's request for return of firearm in 15CV24. 
COURT makes statement and addresses statute regarding return of firearms as it applies in these matters. 
COURT notes it does not have the ability to order the return of the firearm to the deft/respondent. 
COURT questions parties regarding return of firearm to wife. 
Atty Bliss makes statement - requests firearm be turned over to third party proposed buyer rather than wife or deft/respondent. 
Atty Bliss notes parties do have an open divorce case pending. 
State makes statement. 
COURT makes findings. 
COURT grants petition and authorizes release of firearm to wife. 
Atty Bliss to draft order. 
Adj: 2:29 pm
Hearing on May 20, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
Calendar call on April 22, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
B.R.W.
w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk Marisa.
Case Called: 10:55 am 
INCLUDES 15CM72 AND 15CM321. 
State appears by ADA Mike Puerner; Def appears in person with Atty John Bliss.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights filed. VRCW. 

State moves to: 
In 15CM321: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA)>>D&RI. 
                     : Ct. 3 (DC/DA)>>D&RI. 
COURT grants above. 

PLEA: 
In 15CM72: Ct. 1 (Battery/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
                   : Ct. 2 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 
In 15CM321: Ct. 2 (DC/DA)>>NO CONTEST. 

COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made, a factual basis, & def guilty. 
State makes statement. Atty Bliss makes statement. Def makes statement. 

COURT ORDERS: SWH for 14 months probation - CONDITIONS: SAFE program; AODA; assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by the agent; fulltime employment/schooling/combination of the 2 or if not, perform 10 hours community service per week; absolute sobriety from drugs and alcohol except for prescriptions taken as precribed and with pre-authorization of agent; payment of court costs including 3 DA surcharges; provide DNA sample. 
COURT finds the def is entitled to NO days jail credit if revoked. 

Adj: 11:15 am
Plea/sentencing hearing on April 3, 2015 at 10:10 am.
and Demand for Discovery and Inspection
